very simple DIY that does not take long
to do and you don't have to be super
artsy for it to look good
what you are going to need is alcohol
and I'm talking vodka gin or in my case
by Joe I did try to do this with rubbing
alcohol but it did not turn out you'll
also need a little cup to put the
alcohol in some clear and white nail
polish scissors and of course a map
first you are going to paint your nails
with one coat of white nail polish once
your nails are dry you are going to move
on to doing a second coat however you
are only going to work on one nail at a
time the reason for this is because once
you do the second coat do not let your
nail dry completely you're going to want
to wait about a minute a minute and a
half where you can touch the nail polish
and it'll be a little sticky but will
not come off on your finger once the
nail polish is at that stage you can dip
your nail in the alcohol leave it in the
alcohol for about 30 seconds next you're
going to take your little piece of map
that you have cut out each square should
be about an inch an inch and a half in
length and width you're going to place
one of these pieces of map over the nail
that was just soaking in the alcohol and
then you're going to push that paper
nice and hard on your nail for about ten
seconds once you've felt it down for
about 10 to 15 seconds you are going to
slowly peel it away and it should look
like this you may have some little
pieces of paper sticking up from your
nail you can get rid of this by dipping
one of your other fingers in the alcohol
and slowly making some circle circle
motions over that now and it should get
rid of that excess paper once you have
completed all of your nails let them dry
and once they are dry it is ready to put
on the clear nail polish now I use four
coats of clear nail polish just to make
sure that everything is going to stay on
when I wash my hands
and I think they turned out pretty good
I got rid of some excess nail polish on
the sides of my nails and all my skin as
well as little pieces of paper that may
